full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath.

Just confirming we are now just waiting on the short paragraph of text to be added to each product category about the brand itself. For example: https://www.hearingsavers.com.au/brands/Phonak.html?sort=priceasc <https://www.hearingsavers.com.au/brands/Phonak.html?sort=priceasc>;

Brittany

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Pending

full_threads.body:
Hi Brittany, 

Can you please try now? I have cleared the cache.

Hey Heath,

Just wanted to confirm is there a redirection in place for the new page? When I load the page I am automatically redirected to the homepage?
Thanks
Brittany

Hi Brittany, 

Thanks for following up. Yes, here is is a link to the page: https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aids/

Let me know if you need anything else?
@heath sorry about this, will be more careful going forward.

@rica This ticket was closed by you but no work was done on it? 

I'm going to action it now myself... But we will need to be careful about this moving forward. thanks
@heath client asking for follow up

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body:
Hey Heath,

Just following up on the new hearing aids keyword page for Hearing You.

Has this been finalised yet?

Thanks
Brittany

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
Thanks Heath.

Brittany

Hi Brittany, 

Sure, confirming we will work on this today for you and let you know once it's ready to review.

Guys, can we please copy the How We Work page layout (or similar) and add the content from this page:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vThGd3b0GebK8djBKOsTVHvT-PxWSdbecduEBVt0J1c/edit

No need to add it to the main menu for now.

Thanks.

Are we able to then create the new keyword page with the revised content?

Perhaps a similar page layout to your How we work page: https://hearingyou.com.au/how-we-work/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/how-we-work/>

Thanks
Brittany

Subject: Re: SEO Content Suggested Changes

Thanks Brittany,

We have completed the items assigned to us. I have created a Google Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1k075A95GGc7EHTa2blo8RSOVJRxLe6yQPYBxGquc3Oc/edit?usp=sharing <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1k075A95GGc7EHTa2blo8RSOVJRxLe6yQPYBxGquc3Oc/edit?usp=sharing>

A couple of notes:

You will see we have completed the GREEN items (1 and 3).
You are going to do item 5 as mentioned below.
The YELLOW items (2 and 4) and pending copy from Steven.
Regarding item 6. Range Pages, this are filterable attributes and not categories, so they are not actually loading a unique page/url. It’s a Ajax filter. This means there isn’t a provision to add custom titles/intro copy. Their purpose is to help the user refine their search in the shop section. If this is required, we could create 4 landing pages and nest just the appropriate products under each. It’s probably not the best user experience though as it restricts the users ability ’shop’ between ranges. Keen to get your thoughts on this?

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
DIRECTOR

On 20 Jul 2020, at 3:36 pm, Brittany Grimble <brittany@practiceedge.com.au <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>> wrote:

Good Afternoon,

Thought it might be easier to have seperate threads for each digital marketing campaign. Please find below some suggested changes for your SEO campaign.

HOMEPAGE H1:
The text in your <H1> tag should act as a basic summary of the page, closely related to your meta description & meta title. As the header structure title tag number decreases as to does it’s level of importance - it strengthen the relationship between your page title & descriptions; which currently as part of your SEO keywords.

Currently your homepage H1 is: <h1>Latest technology, leading brands and lowest prices</h1>

I would suggest we change this to visually still look the same, but look at the introduction of a smaller line of text directly underneath or above this heading to be: Hearing Aids Sydney

This will tie in with the overall search terms with the highest search volume.

INTERLINKING TO PRODUCT CATEGORY PAGES FROM HOMEPAGE:

Currently the only links to our product category pages are the 4 logo images under the “only the best” heading. For stronger keyword relevance I would suggest we add an intext link to each page within this paragraph of content.

The current content is, please find suggested line of text below in red.

You name it, we’ve tested it. You will notice we only stock the best premium hearing devices and brands such as; Phonak <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/phonak/>, Oticon <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/oticon/>, Signia <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/signia/> and Widex <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/widex/>. This enables us to guarantee the quality of your hearing device and ensures that our prices are the lowest you will find. Our expert team will remotely tune and update your device through your smart phone.

HEARING AID SEO KEYWORD PAGE:

Currently looking at your website and your Sydney based competition they do have a hearing aid based information page on their website. For example Value Hearing (https://valuehearing.com.au/hearing-aids/ <https://valuehearing.com.au/hearing-aids/>) and Starkey (https://www.starkey.com.au/hearing-aids <https://www.starkey.com.au/hearing-aids>).

Are we able to create an information based page for hearing aids aside from your homepage. This will act as your SEO keyword page for hearing aids.
These are some sections that could potentially be included in the website copy:
• What does a hearing aid do?
• What are the best hearing aids to use?
• Types of hearing aids
• How do hearing aids work?
• What to expect from wearing hearing aids
• The brands of hearing aids you supply

PRODUCT CATEGORY PAGES:
https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/phonak/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/phonak/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/oticon/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/oticon/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/signia/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/signia/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/widex/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/hearing-aid/widex/>

Currently each of your product category will act as your keyword pages for these SEO keyword themes. To enhance your SEO keyword rankings for these pages I would suggest some changes to the current product categories.

We need to add a H1 to each product category which is unique to the brand itself. Currently on all product category pages the H1 is “Our hearing aids”.
I suggest we change it to be Phonak Hearing Aids for example.

Also if a short paragraph of text was added to each product category about the brand itself. For example: https://www.hearingsavers.com.au/brands/Phonak.html?sort=priceasc <https://www.hearingsavers.com.au/brands/Phonak.html?sort=priceasc>

PRODUCT PAGES:
To create stronger correlation between the model specific keywords and the brand specific keywords I suggest we interlink between the individual products to the brand product category pages within the product description. I have reviewed all the products within each brand and Widex & Signia all have places throughout the product descriptions where I can add the interlinking.

Whereas on the Phonak & Oticon specific products there isn’t such content to create an interlink. For example https://hearingyou.com.au/product/audeo-marvel-m30-312t/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/product/audeo-marvel-m30-312t/> &https://hearingyou.com.au/product/opn-s-1-minirite-r/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/product/opn-s-1-minirite-r/>

By creating the interlink between product and brand pages it will create a stronger sitemap and relevance for the SEO terms we are trying to target in your organic rankings.

RANGE PAGES:
https://hearingyou.com.au/range/premium/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/range/premium/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/range/advanced/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/range/advanced/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/range/economic/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/range/economic/>
https://hearingyou.com.au/range/essential/ <https://hearingyou.com.au/range/essential/>

Similar to the suggestions as listed above for the product category pages I suggest we also make some changes to your ranges page.
Currently on all product range pages the H1 is “Our hearing aids”.
I suggest we change it to be Economic or Affordable Hearing Aids for example.

Also if a short paragraph of text was added to each product range page about the specifications of all models that fall within this range.

The same way we would add a link from the specific products to the brand pages I suggest we add a link from the specific product pages to each of the applicable range pages.

Any changes please let me know,

Thanks
Brittany
